qas.question: What are Jehovah Witnesses probably best known for by outsiders?

answers.text: their efforts to spread their beliefs

qas.question: How many languages is the Watch Tower Society literature published in?
What is the objective of Jehovah Witnesses' door to door ministry?
When are Jehovah Witnesses advised to discontinue Bibles studies with students?

answers.text: show no interest in becoming members

qas.question: What are baptized members who fail to report a month of preaching termed as?
How many doors does the average Jehovah's Witnesses knock on each month?

plausible_answers.text: show no interest in becoming members

qas.question: What do most people do when a Jehovah's Witness knocks on their door?
What happens to a Jehovah's Witness that is determined to be "inactive"?
How many people are baptized as a Jehovah's Witness each year?

context: Jehovah's Witnesses are perhaps best known for <a0_0>their efforts to spread their beliefs<a0_0/>, most notably by visiting people from house to house, distributing literature published by the Watch Tower Society in <a1_0><b5_0><b8_0>700<b8_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> languages. The objective is to <a2_0>start a regular "Bible study"<a2_0/> with any person who is not already a member, with the intention that the student be baptized as a member of the group; Witnesses are advised to consider discontinuing Bible studies with students who <a3_0><b6_0>show no interest in becoming members<b6_0/><a3_0/>. Witnesses are taught they are under a biblical command to engage in public preaching. They are instructed to devote as much time as possible to their ministry and are required to submit an individual monthly "Field Service Report". Baptized members who fail to report a month of preaching are termed "<a4_0>irregular<a4_0/>" and <b7_0>may be counseled by elders<b7_0/>; those who do not submit reports for six consecutive months are termed "inactive".
